meanings.definition: To use or expend carelessly or extravagantly
meanings.sent1: She wasted all her money on unnecessary things.
meanings.sent2: He wasted his time playing video games instead of studying.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel wasted its acorns by burying them in the wrong place.
meanings.sent4: The leaky faucet wasted water like a broken dam.
meanings.sent5: The careless chef wasted ingredients by burning the dish.

meanings.definition: To fail to use or take advantage of
meanings.sent1: They wasted a great opportunity by not attending the meeting.
meanings.sent2: She wasted her talent by never practicing her skills.
meanings.sent3: The cat wasted the chance to catch the mouse by falling asleep.
meanings.sent4: The student wasted the chance to learn by skipping class.
meanings.sent5: The farmer wasted the fertile land by not planting any crops.

meanings.definition: To become physically or mentally exhausted
meanings.sent1: After running the marathon, he felt completely wasted.
meanings.sent2: She was wasted after a long day of hiking in the mountains.
meanings.sent3: The dog looked wasted after playing fetch for hours.
meanings.sent4: The workers were wasted after a full day of construction.
meanings.sent5: The kids were wasted after playing at the park all day.

meanings.definition: To become intoxicated by alcohol or drugs
meanings.sent1: He got wasted at the party and couldn't remember anything.
meanings.sent2: She felt wasted after drinking too much wine.
meanings.sent3: The bear looked wasted after eating fermented berries.
meanings.sent4: The teenager got wasted at the concert and had to be carried home.
meanings.sent5: The friends got wasted together at the bar and laughed all night.
